data.title: Good choice for a quality lunch
data.text: There are not a lot of options for lunch in this area, but this is clearly the best.  The prices are a little higher, but the quality of the food makes up for that.  I had the curried chicken salad sandwich, and I enjoyed it very much.

data.title: Fantastic casual breakfast and lunch place
data.text: I rarely give five stars to a casual restaurant, but this place deserves it. The breakfast sandwiches are made with a perfectly fried egg and your choice of cheese. I got cheddar, on a bun with rosemary. The curried chicken sandwich is my favorite quick lunch. The salad version is good, too, as is the turkey sandwich. A friend says the sriracha BLT is the best sandwich he has ever had. The little chocolate sablé cookies are a nice snack. Even the drip coffee is good.

data.title: Delicious and healthy food
data.text: I love eating here when Im in town in-between meetings. The food is fresh, mostly local and organic, and very thoughtful

data.title: Great Small Cafe with Eclectic Menu
data.text:
I came here for lunch and was very pleased. The place is tucked away a bit and seating is very limited but the food was very delicious. I ordered a Steak Sammie special and it was one of the best sandwiches that I have had (I hope they offer the special more often). The lavender lemonade was also very delicious.

The menu is a bit eclectic so be prepared to be a bit adventurous with the food combinations. In regards to staff and atmosphere, the place is very welcoming. Overall, it is a great lunch place in Hartford.

data.title: Great Lunch Spot Close to the Capitol
data.text: I always love meeting up with friends at the Kitchen. Very fresh food, great desserts, inventive salads. Prices are a bit on the high side, but I HAPPILY pay a little extra knowing that the Kitchen is training Hartford residents to get jobs in the culinary field! Excellent coffee and great soda selection to boot. One downside is very limited seating, but ask someone to share a table, people here are always super friendly. Or take it to go if it's crowded, it's worth it!

data.title: My first visit...I love it!
data.text: I am very familiar with the Billings Forge complex which includes housing in an old factory, The Studio for events and entertainment, an upscale restaurant, a very popular farmers' market and The Kitchen.  I had been to the complex a number of times but never to The Kitchen.  I went today with a friend who is on a really restricted diet.  The Kitchen was recommended as a place where she could get quality, fresh and tasty food to meet her diet restrictions.  It did not disappoint!  We both really loved our food choices. We were surprised at the number of items on the menu.  There was a nice selection of seasonal salads made with many local products and a large selection of sandwichs made from fresh breads.  I had the Sass-Squash salad made with local greens, goat cheese, roasted butternut squash, and a really good chicken soup.  The Kitchen had a  nice  selection of pastries and beverages including a variety of Hosmer Mountain sodas.  My next trip will be for breakfast!  The Kitchen is well worth the visit!

data.title: Expensive but for a good cause
data.text: Larger than expected. High ceilings, dark wood, painted bricks. Nice sized pub/wine bar in front with outside seating. Situated in a working community to make itself better, sitting outside can be colorful. The wine bar is small but with the high ceilings make it seem open and conversation is contagious. Don't hesitate to stand, or sit. The wait staff is friendly, professional, and local. They do a fine job though the dishes tend to disappear quickly if they feel you are done. Dining in the back is an open room back wall filled with wine with restrooms in the rear. The walls are brick but painted over in scuffed white. Large framed Photographs of local places and other art line the walls and dining area. Ceiling is 20 feet above you. You can still have a quiet conversation. Unfortunately my appetizer or first dish was so good I did not enjoy the second dish. Second dish a pork over a fresh vegetable panzanella. The panzanella was too full of vinegar. It over powered. The pork was dry. The first dish was perfect. Mussles, and the broth was just perfect. Light, tasty, try with a glass of dry white. Would bring it home if possible. $23 to $35 main dish, $10 to $20 first dish. Pages of different wine. Went with a Finger Lakes white around $30 a bottle. Light, drinkable, good. 3 star on the bread (cold). Warming it up before serving would have popped my view of it to a 5 star. Being cold I couldn't get the taste of it. I bet it was delicious.  Still recommend the restaurant for couples or special occasions.

data.title: Bread baked on site, great sandwiches
data.text: First off if you're not familiar with the Kitchen at billings forge, it's a business that prides itself on hiring people that live in the neighborhood. This gives the locals an opportunity to make a decent wage in their own city. What a concept! All that aside, the Kitchen is exactly that- a kitchen that bakes it's own bread and creates some really good and unique sandwiches. The service is friendly and very efficient too.

data.title: Favorite foods with delightful twists
data.text: Arriving for lunch, we found a menu board full of lunch foods that ran the gamut from prosaic to creative.  You can order a standard sandwich featuring a choice of cheeses or lunchmeats like turkey on a choice of bread, or you can go with one of their composed sandwiches or salads. I had the curried chicken salad with chutney sandwich; it was totally delicious.  There are also excellent sides dishes, such as orzo salad, slaw, or potato salad.  They also serve the most beautiful cookies and desserts, fit for a tea party.  The apricot bar was fabulous.  The notable thing about Billings Forge is that so many items have a wonderful little twist that take them above the ordinary.  The chicken salad sandwich came on a cranberry walnut bread that added extra wonderful (and harmonious) flavors.  The potato salad had a little horseradish in it that made it really crave-able.  The apricot bar had an intriguing little bit of rosemary.  Though the restaurant is small, there are a couple of communal tables that will fit you in if the regular tables are full.  Parking isn't always available in the lot in front of the café, but there is adequate street parking.  Also, there is a lot of take-out business, so just wait a couple minutes and someone will leave.  Service was great!  I highly recommend.

data.title: Lunch at the Kitchen
data.text: I cant say enough about the food, everything we tried was wonderful. I definitely recommend the kitchen for lunch!

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: You Cannot go wrong at the kitchen in any way, shape or form!!  Yum!!  From the fabulous food to the entire teaching concept in which the kitchen is based, I even held my husbands 40th birthday dinner cooking party here held on a Saturday night- amazing!!!  People are still talking about it!!

data.title: Fab Organic Local Resturant
data.text: The Kitchen At Billings Forge is a very good, reasonably priced organic resturant. Using the best of locally grown and harvested crops, it's menu is diverse and its food is delicious.

data.title: A culinary gem off the beaten path
data.text: The Kitchen at Billings Forge is a few miles from downtown Hartford, but is well worth the time to eat there.  It's a sterling example of farm-to-table freshness, flavorful and innovative.  It's gourmet healthy eating.  They prepared a lunch for about 100 visiting columnists with the National Society of Newspaper Columnists in late June 2013.  Everyone I spoke with (I was the program co-chair) raved about the array of salads and hearty breads.  The Kitchen is part of a community complex that has singlehandedly transformed the neighborhood.  It's a destination eatery.

data.title: Great Place to Grab some food to go
data.text: Really tasty sandwiches and baked goods. The Sticky Buns are amazing. Its a nice place if you are down neat the capitol.

data.title: wonderful lunch and take out
data.text: the chef is terrific and the staff superior.  The sandwiches are original and delicious. The salads great. The granola just buy and bring it home, you will be going back for more.

data.title: I love this place!
data.text:
Hidden gem.....I love the local-ness of this place.  Not your average cafe/deli type of place.  I had the grown up grilled cheese with smoked gouda, apple chutney...very tasty.  

I like the variation and although I didn't eat it the salads seemed very popular and reminded me of the Seinfeld episode as the were BIG Salads.  Baked goods looked good as well.

A little tough to find (back of Firebox parking lot) but worth the effort.
